ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Type of device
Length of time over which data was collected
Notes: for example, One week, One month

ElementDescription: Max number of days possible for device worn
Device worn on how many days?
Day Number
Whether data collected was for a week or weekday
Time zone of the site collecting the data
Number of hours between UTC  and local device time
Date based on UTC. The date of which data collection started
Time based on UTC. The time of which data collection started
Date based on UTC. The date of which data collection ended
Time based on UTC. The time of which data collection ended
Manufacturer and model of the watch device
Device position on subject
Skin temperature of the subject wearing device in degree Celsius
Device timestamp (date and time) when readings are recorded
Accelerometer x-axis (ADC count)
Accelerometer y-axis (ADC count)
Accelerometer z-axis (ADC count)
Electrodermal activity
Notes: Data from the electrodermal activity sensor expressed in microsiemens (Î¼S)

ElementDescription: IBI Data from device
